October 15,1989: Fiction
CLEAR AND PRESENT DANGER, by Tom Clancy. (Putnam, $21.95.) The C.I.A.'s
Jack Ryan comes to the rescue of Americans fighting Colombian drug lords.
PILLARS OF THE EARTH, by Ken Follett. (Morrow, $22.95.) The lives of men and
women whose fortunes are linked by the construction of a cathedral in 12-th
century England.
JIMMY STEWART AND HIS POEMS, by Jimmy Stewart.  (Crown, $9.95.) Verses
by the venerable motion picture star.
CALIFORNIA GOLD, by John Jakes. (Random House, $19.95.) A young man
from Pennsylvania makes his fortune in 19th-century Los Angeles.
OLDEST LIVING CONFEDERATE WIDOW TELLS ALL, by Allan Gurganus.
(Knopf, $21.95.) A 99-year-old woman reflects on her past.
THE LOST YEARS, by J.M. Dillard. (Pocket, $17.95.) What happened to the crew
of the Enterprise after it completed its five-year "Star Trek" mission.
SILENT PARTNER, by Jonathan Kellerman. (Bantam, $18.95.) The 1897 trek of
four British aristocrats and an Irish manservant across Canada to reach the
Klondike gold fields.
THE JOY LUCK CLUB, by Amy Tan. (Putnam, $18.95.) The tensions and cultural
bonds shared by Chinese-American women and their immigrant mothers.
THE OLD SILENT, by Martha Grimes. (Little, Brown, $18.95.) Scotland Yard's
Richard Jury probes a triple-murder case in the West Country.
THE RUSSIA HOUSE, by John le Carr√©. (Knopf, $19.95.) Espionage changes its
ways as glasnost begins to rust the Iron Curtain.
JOSHUA AND THE CHILDREN, by Joseph F. Girzone. (Macmillian, $13.95.) A
stranger brings hope to a village where violence is a way of life.
THE MINOTAUR, by Stephen Coonts. (Doubleday, $19.95.) The hunt for a mole
in the Pentagon who is giving defense secrets to the Russians.
POLAR STAR, by Martin Cruz Smith. (Random House, $19.95.)  Russian and
American teams investigate the mysterious movements of a Soviet ship in
northern Pacific waters.
MAJESTIC, by Whitley Strieber. (Putnam, $18.95.) Aliens from outer space land in
New Mexico, and the Government suppresses the news.
BLESSINGS, by Belva Plain. (Delacorte, $19.95.) A lawyer's romantic past
catches up with her on the eve of her marriage and the trial of her most important
October 15, 1989
Non-Fiction
ALL I REALLY NEED TO KNOW I LEARNED IN KINDERGARTEN, by Robert
Fulghum. (Villard, $15.95.) Inspirational essays about everyday matters.
IT WAS ON FIRE WHEN I LAY DOWN ON IT, by Robert Fulghum.  (Villard,
$17.95.) A new collection of inspirational essays.
AMONG SCHOOLCHILDREN, by Tracy Kidder. (Richard Todd/Houghton Mifflin,
$19.95.) A year in the life of a fifth-grade teacher in Holyoke, Mass.
IT'S ALWAYS SOMETHING, by Gilda Radner. (Simon & Schuster, $17.95.) The
late comedian's memoir describes her battle with ovarian cancer.
A BRIEF HISTORY OF TIME, by Stephen W. Hawking. (Bantam, $18.95.) A
scientist reviews efforts to create a unified theory of the universe.
I WANT TO GROW HAIR, I WANT TO GROW UP, I WANT TO GO TO BOISE, by
Erma Bombeck. (Harper & Row, $16.95.) Fifteen stories of children surviving
cancer.
ROSEANNE, by Roseanne Barr. (Harper & Row, $18.95.) The autobiography of
the television comedian.
OUT OF BOUNDS, by Jim Brown with Steve Delsohn.  (Zebra, $17.95.) The
autobiography of the former professional football player and film star.
FROM BEIRUT TO JERUSALEM, by Thomas L. Friedman. (Farrar, Straus &
Giroux, $22.95.) The Arab-Israeli conflict as observed by a New York times
correspondent over the past decade.
BO, by Bo Schembechler and Mitch Alborn. (Warner, $17.95.) Big-time college
football as lived and observed by the coach of the Michigan Wolverines.
THE WRITING LIFE, by Annie Dillard. (Harper & Row, $15.95.) A novelist
describes and reflects on the creative process.
THE FIGHTING SPIRIT, by Lou Holitz with John Heisler. (Pocket, $18.95.) Notre
Dame's football coach reports on the 1988 championship season.
THE CONTROL OF NATURE, by John McPhee.  (Farrar, Straus & Giroux,
$17.95.) How people in Mississippi, Iceland and California coped with raging
rivers, lava and wind, fire and heavy rain.
LOVE'S EXECUTIONER, by Irvin D. Yalom. (Basic, $19.95.) Case histories from a
Stanford psychiatrist's files.
A WOMAN NAMED JACKIE, by C. David Heymann. (Lyle Stuart, $21.95.) A
biography of Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis.
